result.execSummary:
The defendant Dyrell T Minor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf'r Falsely Present NonDrug as Drug, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber.
Standard release conditions.
3 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Buy Money as well, but will be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Dept.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to use or possess of any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
